update.releaseNotes:
v4.2.4 - Changelog
New --- - Add new buttons to the MessageLog component to sort ascending or descending. - Add new buttons to the MessageLog component to scroll to the top/bottom of the log. - Add a preview screen to review what settings will be overwritten when importing a settings JSON file. - Add a new option to the Misc section of the Settings page to display message log IDs. - Add a new Profile function to the Training Settings page to allow for creation/management of profiles to switch between. Import/Export logic has also been updated to handle Profiles as well. Example: Keeping separate customized profiles for Mile and Long runners. - Add a new option to the Training Settings page to allow the user to set a custom stat cap to stop training on other than the default of 1200. - Add a new option to the Training Settings page to allow the user to train Wit during the Final instead of recovering energy. - Add a new option in the Misc section of the Settings page to stop the bot before the Finals on turn 72 - Add POST_NOTIFICATIONS permission to the AndroidManifest.xml file to potentially help people who are not encountering the popup to enable notification permission. - The package.json file now has 2 new commands for quicker testing of the app. - Add Android logic to perform one-time scenario validation check to ensure that the bot is running the correct scenario (Unity Cup for now). - Add a note to the Racing Plan Settings page to remind users to check their selected races after making changes to the filters.
Adjustments --- - Update game data up to Halloween Rice Shower and Super Creek. - Bump version of Automation Library to incorporate some improvements to the message log handling. - Adjust warning message regarding Debug tests in the Settings page to clarify that it is not required for the tests to run. - Change some error messages to be shown as Snackbar notifications. - Shift priority weight for event chains for TrainingEvent class to prioritize guaranteed recreation/dating for supports like Riko. - Update date detection logic to better handle the Finals in-game dates. - Update logic to dismiss the scheduled race popup warning when executing a training at the end of the Training process. - Remove unnecessary fields from settings before exporting to cut down on the size of the exported JSON file. - Change the Focus on Spark
Fixed --- - Fix most instances of log messages being out of order in the MessageLog component. - Fix bug where mood recovery could not be completed if dating was available and already completed. Example: Riko Support. - Fix rare bug where the intro message in the MessageLog component would be missing the app name and version due to missing dependency in the callback function. - Fix bug where "Finale Underway" was not being parsed correctly by GameDateParser. - Fix bug where risky training was not being started when the initial failure chance was not being checked with the risky training threshold.
